content:
• Friday, July 8, 2011
  • SKM

    Korean wireless carrier SK Telecom (NYSE:SKM) is bidding for a 15% stake in Hynix Semiconductor...

    Korean wireless carrier SK Telecom (NYSE:SKM) is bidding for a 15% stake in Hynix Semiconductor (HKSCF.PK), the world's second-largest DRAM manufacturer. Investors aren't thrilled with SK Telecom's plans to enter the chip business, and sent the company's shares down 6.3% today.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:15 PM
  • HNSN

    Medical robotics firm Hansen Medical (HNSN +12.4%) continues to soar on heavy volume after...

    Medical robotics firm Hansen Medical (HNSN +12.4%) continues to soar on heavy volume after breaking out of a key technical resistance level earlier this week. The stock has been the focus of momentum traders over the past few sessions, gaining +36% since the holiday break.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:53 PM
  • VMED

    Virgin Media (NASDAQ:VMED) falls -3.9% after Bank of America says the firm has zero organic...

    Virgin Media (NASDAQ:VMED) falls -3.9% after Bank of America says the firm has zero organic growth, and faces competitive pressure on core products. Another punch in the face for the company is collateral damage from losing its advertising relationship with scandal-ridden New of the World.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:01 PM
  • DKS

    Dick's Sporting Goods (NYSE:DKS) is down 6.7% following reports that "second quarter trends are...

    Dick's Sporting Goods (NYSE:DKS) is down 6.7% following reports that "second quarter trends are running at the low end of expectations." Dick's previously forecast FQ2 EPS to be in the range of $0.47-$0.49, with same-store sales rising 3% annually.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:48 PM
  • ADM

    Shares of Archer Daniels (ADM +1.3%) receive a lift when Warren Buffett names the firm as the...

    Shares of Archer Daniels (ADM +1.3%) receive a lift when Warren Buffett names the firm as the "kind of company we look at" for deals, apparently meeting Berkshire's (BRK.A -1.5%) right mix of low-debt and growing earnings. Also mentioned by the Oracle as attractive was General Dynamic (GD -1.5%) and Exelon (EXC -0.5%).
     
     
     
     
    | 2:35 PM | 2 Comments
  • ARJ

    Arch Chemicals (NYSE:ARJ), a maker of chemicals for water sanitation purposes, is up 9.1 %...

    Arch Chemicals (NYSE:ARJ), a maker of chemicals for water sanitation purposes, is up 9.1 % today, putting its shares within striking distance of their 52-week high. Though trading volume is already more than 4x Arch's 3-month average, no news has hit the wires explaining the move. Arch's shares also rose on unusually high volume on Wednesday.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:32 PM
  • SOL

    ReneSola (SOL -4.4%) gets hit again today after Goldman throws in the towel, cutting it to sell...

    ReneSola (SOL -4.4%) gets hit again today after Goldman throws in the towel, cutting it to sell and slashing its price target from $12 down to $4. The firm sees the company's profitability hindered by oversupply and a potentially "prolonged wafer price war."

     
     
     
     
    | 2:19 PM | 2 Comments
  • LVS

    One of the few sectors on the upswing today is gaming stocks, after JPMorgan raises price...

    One of the few sectors on the upswing today is gaming stocks, after JPMorgan raises price targets on Las Vegas Sands (LVS +1.1%), Wynn (WYNN +2.5%), MGM Grand (MGM +1.1%) and Melco Crown (MPEL +3.6%). The firm raised targets for LVS to $56 from $55, WYNN to $174 from $158, MGM to $20 from $19, and MPEL to $14 from $11.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:14 PM
  • MBOT

    Shares of several stem-cell research companies jump following news that Swedish doctors replaced...

    Shares of several stem-cell research companies jump following news that Swedish doctors replaced the cancer-stricken windpipe of a patient with an organ made in a lab: StemCells (STEM +19.9%), Geron (GERN +8.6%), Pluristem (PSTI +4.3%), Mesoblast (MBLTY.PK +3.6%), Cytori (CYTX +2.7%).
     
     
     
     
    | 1:58 PM | 2 Comments
  • FTFT

    ChinaSky Specialty Juice (SPU +17.8%) pops after announcing it's suing short-seller Absaroka...

    ChinaSky Specialty Juice (SPU +17.8%) pops after announcing it's suing short-seller Absaroka Capital for defamation. The company says Absaroka published an article in June "containing several false allegations and accusations against the company," and has refused to retract its statements.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:47 PM
  • ALXN

    UBS cuts estimates on Alexion Pharmaceuticals (ALXN +3.1%), and lowers its price target to $53...

    UBS cuts estimates on Alexion Pharmaceuticals (ALXN +3.1%), and lowers its price target to $53 from $55, keeping a Neutral rating on the firm. Shares are outgaining all issues listed on the NASDAQ-100.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:15 PM
  • ADM

    Despite the repeal of the ethanol tax credit yesterday, corn futures +3% on reports of strong...

    Despite the repeal of the ethanol tax credit yesterday, corn futures +3% on reports of strong demand from China, giving a lift to Archer Daniels (ADM +0.6%).
     
     
     
     
    | 12:50 PM
  • MWW

    Though Monster (NYSE:MWW) isn't responding well to today's disappointing jobs data, LinkedIn...

    Though Monster (NYSE:MWW) isn't responding well to today's disappointing jobs data, LinkedIn (LNKD) is now up 5.2% on the day. Do investors expect ongoing high unemployment to lead job-hunters to flock to the business networking site?
     
     
     
     
    | 12:50 PM
  • YGE

    Yingli Green Energy (YGE -5.7%) trades lower after Goldman cuts the stock to sell. The firm says...

    Yingli Green Energy (YGE -5.7%) trades lower after Goldman cuts the stock to sell. The firm says the solar supplier's operating costs are higher and more inflexible than that of its peers, making its earnings vulnerable to competitive pricing pressures.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:57 AM | 1 Comment
  • EWI

    Meanwhile, the situation deteriorates in Italy, as trading resumes in UniCredit and shares...

    Meanwhile, the situation deteriorates in Italy, as trading resumes in UniCredit and shares continue to slide, now -7.7%, and Italian short-term debt surges past 6%. EWI -4.6%. (earlier)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:28 AM | 2 Comments
  • CAT

    Shares of Caterpillar (CAT -2.4%) tail off after a weak jobs report, and as the firm faces dodgy...

    Shares of Caterpillar (CAT -2.4%) tail off after a weak jobs report, and as the firm faces dodgy tax accusations in a lawsuit filed by an ex-exec. The suit says CAT incorrectly attributed at least $5.6B in profits to an off-shore unit, a charge the firm denies.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:24 AM
  • TXN

    The weak jobs report is hitting tech shares hard, especially chip stocks (SOXX -1.9%) which had...

    The weak jobs report is hitting tech shares hard, especially chip stocks (SOXX -1.9%) which had rallied smartly in recent weeks on hopes of a more solid recovery. Among chip bellwethers:  TXN -2.7%, AMD -2.5%, ADI -2.2%, BRCM -2.2%, NVDA -2.2%, MU -2.1%, QCOM -1.9%, INTC -1.6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:13 AM
  • MGM

    Shares of MGM (MGM -1.3%) slump with the market, despite positive feedback from analysts....

    Shares of MGM (MGM -1.3%) slump with the market, despite positive feedback from analysts. JPMorgan reiterates an Overweight rating, and ups its target to $20 from $19. Credit Agricole initiates coverage with an Outperform rating, and a $16 target.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:03 AM
  • CREE

    CREE -4.6% takes a hit from SemiLEDs' (LEDS -4.5%) numbers miss last night. The damage seems...

    CREE -4.6% takes a hit from SemiLEDs' (LEDS -4.5%) numbers miss last night. The damage seems slight, however, when compared to the 50% drop it's suffered from the beginning of the year, as demand for LED backlighting continues to decline.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:45 AM
  • MWW

    Monster Worldwide (MWW -5.8%) is the S&P's leading loser in early trading after the...

    Monster Worldwide (MWW -5.8%) is the S&P's leading loser in early trading after the disappointing June jobs report. Other job recruiters also are in the red: MAN -3.6%, LNKD -0.3%.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:11 AM
  • ARX

    Electronic component and test equipment maker Aeroflex (NYSE:ARX) is down 17.1% after slashing...

    Electronic component and test equipment maker Aeroflex (NYSE:ARX) is down 17.1% after slashing FQ4 revenue guidance to a range of $198M-$200M, from a prior range of $220M-$228M. The company says it can't provide earnings guidance for the quarter, but it's safe to assume EPS will be below the guidance range of $0.40-$0.44.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:06 AM
  • FBR

    Fibria Celulose (FBR -3.3%) is cut to neutral by Goldman and removed from its LatAm Focus List....

    Fibria Celulose (FBR -3.3%) is cut to neutral by Goldman and removed from its LatAm Focus List. The firm cites weak pulp prices over the near-term, and a lack of any catalyst to turn around sluggish European demand for paper products.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:51 AM
  • TI

    Telecom Italia (TI -3.3%) is acquiring Brazilian fiber optic network owner AES Atimus, a unit of...

    Telecom Italia (TI -3.3%) is acquiring Brazilian fiber optic network owner AES Atimus, a unit of American power company AES, for approximately $1B. Telecom Italia, which already controls Brazil's 3rd-largest wireless carrier, expects the AES Atimus deal to "provide savings worth 1 billion Brazilian reais [$641M] over three years."

     
     
     
     
    | 9:01 AM
  • BMY

    Premarket gainers: AMLN +6%. GERN +4%.Losers: XXIA -19%. ALV -8%. PMI -7%. VE -5%. RDN -4%. DANG...

    Premarket gainers: AMLN +6%. GERN +4%.
    Losers: XXIA -19%. ALV -8%. PMI -7%. VE -5%. RDN -4%. DANG -4%. CREE -4%. RENN -5%. MWE -4%. NOK -3%. SOL -3%. YOKU -3%. STD -3%. MPEL -3%. E -3%. AEO -3%. ARMH -3%. LYG -3%. SDRL -3%. RBS -3%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:00 AM
  • GERN

    Geron (NASDAQ:GERN) releases positive data from a clinical trial of its human embryonic stem...

    Geron (NASDAQ:GERN) releases positive data from a clinical trial of its human embryonic stem cell-based therapy. JPMorgan initiates coverage with an Overweight rating. Shares +5.4% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:59 AM
  • ALV

    Autoliv (NYSE:ALV) says the company's operating results and cash flows will be materially...

    Autoliv (NYSE:ALV) says the company's operating results and cash flows will be materially impacted from the current antitrust probe by the DOJ and EC. Since the investigation is still ongoing, the firm is unable to estimate the impact, nor predict the reporting periods it will affect. Shares -6% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:51 AM
  • BMY

    Three partners in the development of diabetes drug Bydureon - Amylin (AMLN), Alkermes...

    Three partners in the development of diabetes drug Bydureon - Amylin (AMLN), Alkermes (NASDAQ:ALKS) and Eli Lilly (NYSE:LLY) - say the treatment didn’t slow heart rate in further testing requested last year by the FDA. ALKS +1.4%, AMLN +6.9%, LLY -0.7% premarket. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 8:50 AM

  • After dropping sharply in the immediate aftermath of the NFP report, the euro is surging vs. the...

    After dropping sharply in the immediate aftermath of the NFP report, the euro is surging vs. the greenback, a startling move of 130 pips in minutes, and now down just -0.3% for the day at $1.4315. European shares remain 1.2% lower.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:49 AM

  • Stocks dive following surprisingly weak payroll data. S&P -1% to 1339. Euro down a bit more,...

    Stocks dive following surprisingly weak payroll data. S&P -1% to 1339. Euro down a bit more, now -0.9% to $1.4196. 10-year Tsy note soars 0.63% to 123-07. Crude -0.8% to $97.95. (see: pre-NFP benchmark)

     
     
     
     
    | 8:32 AM
  • LEDS

    SemiLEDS (NASDAQ:LEDS) down 14% premarket after missing estimates badly last night. Jefferies...

    SemiLEDS (NASDAQ:LEDS) down 14% premarket after missing estimates badly last night. Jefferies lowers price target to $5 from $6, but keeps a Hold rating in place.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:27 AM
  • GOOG

    Morgan Stanley is downgrading Google (GOOG -1.4%) to Equal-Weight from Overweight, and lowering...

    Morgan Stanley is downgrading Google (GOOG -1.4%) to Equal-Weight from Overweight, and lowering its PT to $600 from $640. The firm's arguments: margins will fall due to rising spending; non-core businesses won't boost near-term growth by much; and the jury's still out on Google's local commerce and social networking moves.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:59 AM
